title: Blended Learning Design for HIV/AIDS Prevention Education Targeting Adolescents

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational health knowledge and completion of sex education
context.additional_context: In-service practitioners (teachers/social workers) with experience designing and implementing youth education, conducting asynchronous LMS-based learning in personal device environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain AIDS transmission routes and prevention methods with over 85% accuracy
Learners can apply at least three of Mayer's multimedia principles when designing AIDS prevention education content for adolescents
Learners can propose at least two effective interaction strategies in blended learning environments

resources: Latest Statistical Data on AIDS Prevention Education

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
